kafka-connect:position-deletes:v2.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not write position delete files
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends

kafka-connect:position-deletes:v3.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not write position delete files
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends

kafka-connect:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not write equality delete files
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; equality deletes require Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not write equality delete files
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; equality deletes require Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; merge-on-read not applicable
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends

kafka-connect:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; merge-on-read not applicable
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends

kafka-connect:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Sink connector does not rewrite data files for mutations

kafka-connect:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Sink connector does not rewrite data files for mutations

kafka-connect:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Schema evolution adds missing record fields to the table schema when iceberg.tables.evolve-schema-enabled is true
caveats: Only supports adding new columns; does not support column renaming, reordering, or type promotion

kafka-connect:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Schema evolution adds missing record fields to the table schema when iceberg.tables.evolve-schema-enabled is true
caveats: Only supports adding new columns; does not support column renaming, reordering, or type promotion

kafka-connect:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:column-default-values:v3.notes: Sink connector does not manage or set column default values

kafka-connect:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: No documented support for nanosecond timestamp types in the sink connector

kafka-connect:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Partition transforms can be specified via iceberg.tables.default-partition-by or per-table partition-by when auto-creating tables
caveats: Only applies during auto table creation; does not modify partitioning of existing tables

kafka-connect:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Partition transforms can be specified via iceberg.tables.default-partition-by or per-table partition-by when auto-creating tables
caveats: Only applies during auto table creation; does not modify partitioning of existing tables

kafka-connect:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Sink connector does not support modifying partition specs of existing tables

kafka-connect:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Sink connector does not support modifying partition specs of existing tables

kafka-connect:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument partition transforms are a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: No documented support for multi-argument partition transforms in the sink connector

kafka-connect:time-travel:v2.notes: Sink-only connector; does not support read operations or time travel queries

kafka-connect:time-travel:v3.notes: Sink-only connector; does not support read operations or time travel queries

kafka-connect:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Sink connector does not provide table maintenance operations (compaction, expiring snapshots, etc.)

kafka-connect:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Sink connector does not provide table maintenance operations (compaction, expiring snapshots, etc.)

kafka-connect:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Supports writing to a specific branch via iceberg.tables.default-commit-branch or per-table commit-branch configuration
caveats: Write-to-branch only; cannot create, delete, or manage branches/tags

kafka-connect:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Supports writing to a specific branch via iceberg.tables.default-commit-branch or per-table commit-branch configuration
caveats: Write-to-branch only; cannot create, delete, or manage branches/tags

kafka-connect:read-support:v2.notes: Sink-only connector; does not support reading Iceberg tables

kafka-connect:read-support:v3.notes: Sink-only connector; does not support reading Iceberg tables

kafka-connect:write-insert:v2.notes: Appends records from Kafka topics into Iceberg tables with exactly-once delivery semantics

kafka-connect:write-insert:v3.notes: Appends records from Kafka topics into Iceberg tables with exactly-once delivery semantics

kafka-connect:write-merge-update-delete:.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not support MERGE, UPDATE, or DELETE operations
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; upsert/CDC modes require Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:write-merge-update-delete:.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; does not support MERGE, UPDATE, or DELETE operations
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; upsert/CDC modes require Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Supports REST, Hive, Hadoop as built-in catalog types, plus Glue, DynamoDB, Nessie, JDBC, and BigQuery Metastore via catalog-impl

kafka-connect:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Supports REST, Hive, Hadoop as built-in catalog types, plus Glue, DynamoDB, Nessie, JDBC, and BigQuery Metastore via catalog-impl

kafka-connect:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Hive Metastore is a built-in catalog type; requires HMS client distribution or adding HMS client dependency

kafka-connect:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Hive Metastore is a built-in catalog type; requires HMS client distribution or adding HMS client dependency

kafka-connect:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: AWS Glue Catalog supported via iceberg.catalog.catalog-impl with GlueCatalog; documented with configuration examples

kafka-connect:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: AWS Glue Catalog supported via iceberg.catalog.catalog-impl with GlueCatalog; documented with configuration examples

kafka-connect:rest-catalog:v2.notes: REST Catalog is a built-in catalog type with first-class support and documented configuration examples

kafka-connect:rest-catalog:v3.notes: REST Catalog is a built-in catalog type with first-class support and documented configuration examples

kafka-connect:nessie:v2.notes: Nessie supported via iceberg.catalog.catalog-impl with NessieCatalog; documented with configuration examples

kafka-connect:nessie:v3.notes: Nessie supported via iceberg.catalog.catalog-impl with NessieCatalog; documented with configuration examples

kafka-connect:polaris:v2.notes: Polaris can be used via REST Catalog protocol as Polaris implements the Iceberg REST Catalog spec
caveats: Not explicitly documented; works through REST Catalog compatibility

kafka-connect:polaris:v3.notes: Polaris can be used via REST Catalog protocol as Polaris implements the Iceberg REST Catalog spec
caveats: Not explicitly documented; works through REST Catalog compatibility

kafka-connect:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Unity Catalog is not supported by the Kafka Connect Iceberg sink connector

kafka-connect:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Unity Catalog is not supported by the Kafka Connect Iceberg sink connector

kafka-connect:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Hadoop is a built-in catalog type with first-class support

kafka-connect:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Hadoop is a built-in catalog type with first-class support

kafka-connect:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: JDBC Catalog supported via catalog-impl but JDBC drivers are not included in the default distribution
caveats: Requires adding JDBC driver dependency manually

kafka-connect:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: JDBC Catalog supported via catalog-impl but JDBC drivers are not included in the default distribution
caveats: Requires adding JDBC driver dependency manually

kafka-connect:table-creation:v2.notes: Supports automatic table creation via iceberg.tables.auto-create-enabled with schema inferred from incoming records
caveats: Schema derived from incoming Kafka records; supports configuring partitioning and identity columns via connector properties

kafka-connect:table-creation:v3.notes: Supports automatic table creation via iceberg.tables.auto-create-enabled with schema inferred from incoming records
caveats: Schema derived from incoming Kafka records; supports configuring partitioning and identity columns via connector properties

kafka-connect:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:variant-type:v3.notes: No documented support for Iceberg variant type in the sink connector

kafka-connect:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:shredded-variant:v3.notes: No documented support for shredded variant in the sink connector

kafka-connect:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:geometry-type:v3.notes: No documented support for geometry type in the sink connector

kafka-connect:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

kafka-connect:vector-type:v3.notes: No documented support for vector type in the sink connector

kafka-connect:cdc-support:v2.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; CDC/upsert modes are only available in the Tabular/Confluent commercial connector
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; CDC requires Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:cdc-support:v3.notes: Apache Iceberg OSS Kafka Connect sink is append-only; CDC/upsert modes are only available in the Tabular/Confluent commercial connector
caveats: OSS connector only supports appends; CDC requires Tabular/Confluent commercial connector

kafka-connect:lineage:v2.notes: Sink connector does not provide lineage tracking capabilities

kafka-connect:lineage:v3.notes: Sink connector does not provide lineage tracking capabilities

kafka-connect:statistics:v2.notes: Kafka Connect Iceberg sink writes basic column statistics to manifest files via the standard Iceberg write path when appending data
caveats: Sink-only connector; limited statistics configuration

kafka-connect:statistics:v3.notes: Basic column statistics written via standard Iceberg write path for V3 tables
caveats: Limited statistics configuration compared to Spark

kafka-connect:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Kafka Connect Iceberg sink does not support configuring Parquet-level bloom filters or Puffin-based bloom filter statistics
caveats: Sink-only connector with limited write configuration options

kafka-connect:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Kafka Connect Iceberg sink does not support bloom filters for V3 tables

kafka-connect:type-promotion:v2.notes: The Iceberg Kafka Connect sink connector does not support type promotion. Schema evolution is limited to adding new columns
caveats: Kafka Connect sink only supports adding new columns for schema evolution

kafka-connect:type-promotion:v3.notes: The Iceberg Kafka Connect sink connector does not support type promotion for V3 tables
caveats: Kafka Connect sink only supports adding new columns for schema evolution
